intro: Eriocephalus pteronoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eriocephalus, is a South African plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, pale yellow to white flowers arranged in dense, spherical heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in fynbos vegetation. It is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of the region, with a dormant summer period and active growth during the winter months. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
